entries.meaning: (US, Canada) A battery-powered hand-held light source.
examples: At school he used to do Dr. Jekyll turning into Mr. Hyde, shining a flashlight into his face.

entries.meaning: A flashgun (device used to create flashes of light for photography).
examples: He sat in an arm-chair with his forefinger to his temple, and when the photographer's flashlight went off, he hoped that the hotel had caught fire and that this would end it all.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A photograph taken with a flash camera.

verbs.description: flashlight (third-person singular simple present flashlights, present participle flashlighting, simple past and past participle flashlit)

examples: Autis stepped carefully while flashlighting the fog in front of himself and Gar.
